treePlot

Source: R/treePlot.R
treePlot.Rd

The treePlot function creates a hierarchical tree plot to visualize gene set enrichment analysis (GSEA) results. The tree plot groups similar pathways together based on gene overlap and displays them as a dendrogram, providing an intuitive way to explore functional clusters and pathway relationships. Color and size mappings represent enrichment significance and gene counts, respectively.

Usage

treePlot(
  seDataFgsea,
  showCategory = 10,
  dotColor = "pvalue",
  hclustfun = "ward.D",
  labelFormat = NULL,
  labelFormatTiplab = NULL,
  cexCategory = 1,
  leafFontSize = 3,
  cladeFontSize = 2.5,
  hilightParams = list(hilight = TRUE, align = "both"),
  offsetParams = list(barTree = rel(1.3), tiplab = rel(1.5), extend = 0.3, hexpand = 0.1),
  clusterParams = list(method = "ward.D", n = 5, color = NULL, labelWordsN = 0,
    labelFormat = 30)
)

Arguments

seDataFgsea

A SummarizedExperiment object containing GSEA results in its metadata. The object must include:

  • metadata(seDataFgsea)$gseaResult: GSEA result object with pathway information, enrichment statistics, and core enrichment genes.

showCategory

Integer or character. Specifies the number of top pathways to display, or a vector of pathway IDs/names to include. Must include at least 5 pathways. Default is 10.

dotColor

Character. Column name in the GSEA results used to map color. Options: 'pvalue', 'p.adjust', 'qvalue', or 'NES'. Default is 'pvalue'.

hclustfun

Character. Hierarchical clustering method used to group pathways. Options include 'ward.D', 'ward.D2', 'single', 'complete', 'average', 'mcquitty', 'median', or 'centroid'. Default is 'ward.D'.

labelFormat

Optional. Numeric or function controlling text wrapping or formatting for clade labels.

labelFormatTiplab

Optional. Numeric or function controlling text formatting for terminal node (tip) labels.

cexCategory

Numeric. Scaling factor for node size and label spacing. Default is 1.

leafFontSize

Numeric. Font size for terminal node labels. Default is 3.

cladeFontSize

Numeric. Font size for clade (internal node) labels. Default is 2.5.

hilightParams

List. Controls highlighting and alignment behavior for clades. Default is list(hilight = TRUE, align = "both").

  • hilight: Whether to shade cluster regions.

  • align: Text alignment mode for cluster labels.

offsetParams

List. Controls tree and label positioning parameters. Default is list(barTree = rel(1.3), tiplab = rel(1.5), extend = 0.3, hexpand = 0.1).

  • barTree: Horizontal spacing between tree branches and text.

  • tiplab: Distance between tips and labels.

  • extend: Extension of the tree layout for clarity.

  • hexpand: Expansion ratio applied to x-axis layout.

clusterParams

List. Parameters for hierarchical clustering and labeling. Default is list(method = "ward.D", n = 5, color = NULL, labelWordsN = 0, labelFormat = 30).

  • method: Clustering algorithm.

  • n: Number of clusters to divide the tree into.

  • color: Optional vector for custom cluster colors.

  • labelWordsN: Maximum number of words shown in clade labels.

  • labelFormat: Text wrapping width for clade labels.

Value

A list containing two elements:

treePlot

A ggtree object displaying the hierarchical clustering of pathways with color-coded enrichment metrics and cluster highlights.

tableTreePlot

A data.frame containing pathway-level data for terminal nodes, including label names, selected color variable (e.g., pvalue, p.adjust, or NES), and gene counts.

Details

The treePlot function organizes enriched pathways into functional clusters based on term similarity (gene overlap) and visualizes them using a dendrogram structure. Users can customize appearance through nested parameter lists (hilightParams, offsetParams, clusterParams) to fine-tune alignment, spacing, and label style.

Internal hierarchical clustering is computed via stats::hclust, and visualization is rendered using ggtree. Terminal nodes (tips) correspond to enriched pathways, with color intensity representing enrichment significance and point size corresponding to the number of core genes per pathway.

Examples

data("sig2Fun_result")
treePlot(seDataFgsea = sig2Fun_result,
          showCategory = 10,
          dotColor = "pvalue",
          hclustfun = "ward.D")
#> Error in rel(1.5): could not find function "rel"
